website_summaries.verdict: This metal polish was made for metal on your car, primarily aluminum, brass, and alloys.
pros: Can also restore plastic headlight lenses
Cleans with less effort than other metal cleaners
Doesn't smell as bad as others on the market
Can help with discolored metal dishes and platters that have been through the dishwasher
Can take small scratches out of stainless steel

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is magical! If any of you are ...
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magical! If any of you are looking for something to polish up your stainless firearms with. This is the way to go! Check out the before and after pictures!
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Wow!  Headlights shine now!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after seeing a video on You-Tube by Sweet Project Cars where he used it to repair the clouded headlight plastic on cars.. Even though I don't own a buffer, I decided to try this using the old manual buffer, elbow grease. Wow! My 1994 Chevy pickup headlights were totally clouded; they now shine. You can see the silver reflectors and bulbs with totally clarity. It worked so well that I did my siblings vehicles when they came to visit. I can only imagine how much better this would have worked with a good electric buffer ( it would at least have saved me some time).
customer_reviews.author: Keoni

customer_reviews.title: Works Very Well!!!
customer_reviews.text: Used this to restore opaque/foggy car headlights and was very impressed with the results! I did use a 3M buffer sponge attachment which I hooked to my drill, just a regular drill is what I used. Applied the polish directly to headlights and sponge and then began buffering. The headlights look so much better than what they looked prior. They obviously do not look brand new but definitely look very good! I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: VROD

customer_reviews.title: Great on headlights hase
customer_reviews.text: Like other people, I too saw the videos on clearing foggy headlights using Mothers, and figured I would try it on my 13 year old Rav4's headlights. Took less then 5 mins each using a drill buffer. I am very pleased with the results. After the first light was done I took a picture of the completed light and the non-treated on and posted here. it's hard to see how good it worked, as they look better then the picture shows. I don't know how long it will last, but if I need to do every 6 months, that's fine with me to see at night.
customer_reviews.author: BM from Boston

customer_reviews.title: If you're a jewelry maker/metalsmith you're gonna LOVE this!  <3 <3 <3
customer_reviews.text: If you're a jewelry maker who doesn't have a tumbler-- THIS IS FOR YOU. I've been polishing my work by hand with polish pads, and ugh.. takes forever. Mother's solves that problem in 2 minutes or less. I mostly work with aircraft aluminum, and wow- it takes a dull brushed finished to near mirror finish with next to no work, very little time, and it makes SUCH a difference in how my work turns out-- plus? Saves me a ton of "shop time" now that I'm not wasting 50% of my time laboriously rubbing away on my work just to get it shiny.
customer_reviews.author: Lizzie

customer_reviews.title: Works wonders on plastics such as headlights & watch face
customer_reviews.text: Bought this after watching a YouTube video on how to restore foggy headlights on vehicles. Works great! Did it on 6 vehicles already and it restored them to close to original clearness. See picture showing the left headlight done using Mother's product. Right side untouched. Also used it on my daughters plastic face on her watch where she accidentally sprayed sunblock on it and it fogged up. I used Mother's and brought the watch back to its clear face. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: M. Chung

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly great product
customer_reviews.text: The aluminum wheels and sprocket on my '99 Harley FLHTCUI were rough and pitted. I'm sprucing the bike up for a long trip so I'm scrubbing it with ammonia, waxing and a silicone top coat. I didn't know how to clean/wax aluminum wheels so I searched for aluminum polish and bought Mothers and their PowerCone. I was surprised at how easily and well it worked. The wheels are now smooth and almost look chromed. One of the few products I've found in my life that really works.
customer_reviews.author: N1ven

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars Isn't Enough!
customer_reviews.text: This polish is truly a miracle in a jar. Everything I've applied this to has improved...vastly improved. Stainless steel revolver from the early 1900s looks brand new. A brass bed that had been in the family since the 1800s has that original brass shine that I have never seen before (we have literally spent thousands of dollars on different tarnish removers and polishes to no avail). Headlights look brand new. I'm literally trying to find other household items to try to polish and improve. Even more amazing, this product takes so little effort or elbow grease, a three year old could successfully use thus. Highly, highly recommended and will be buying many more to have on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Making Reviews Great Again

customer_reviews.title: Finally something that really works
customer_reviews.text: This stuff really works. Had some really yellowed headlights. Used it with a Dewalt drill polisher, I don't think you really need one of the big pieces of power tools. I did not sand anything just put on the polish and buffed it off. Looked like showroom stuff. There are some scratches but I am sure if you wanted to sand them out you could. Whole process may have taken 3 minutes. Already have 3 friends heading out to buy this stuff. Just for fun used on my chrome. Again just paste and polish. Looks like a mirror now. I will use this stuff for everything applicable. Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.author: Equity Investor

customer_reviews.title: Mothers Polish used to remove nicks and scratches from a Stainless Steel (316L) watch
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Mothers Mag and Aluminum polish for a different purpose. I used it to polish small nicks out of my Omega stainless steel (316L) watch. I was a little afraid to use it as I did not want to ruin my watch. But was careful and went slow using a Qtip with a small amount of the material on the nicks. It worked great, I would recommend it for minor nicks or scratches on a watch or band. I could not get a good picture to show the different of before and after. I hope this review helps someone out there with a similar requirement.
customer_reviews.author: G Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product. Read this!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! It polishes Aluminum obviously, but it polishes plastic, like tail lights, turn signals, clear gauge panels. ie. Speedometer / Tach... whatever! Eliminates larger scratches, makes them clear again. Stainless steel, even some scratches on paint. Yes, like your car. It is more of a multi purpose polish. Obviously you need to test it if you can, and use just a little, but it really works! And I've used it for nearly 40 years, so I actually know that it does what I've stated it does! Your welcome, Mothers.
customer_reviews.author: Screen saver!

customer_reviews.title: AMAZING polish on Sterling Silver
customer_reviews.text: Last week met a woman at a medical office waiting room who told me Mothers Mag & Aluminum polish does a great job polishing sterling silver - so I bought 3 containers as soon as I got home - one as a gift. I am astonished Mother does a FABULOUS job on Sterling Silver & costs multiples less than Haggerty & the other classics. All you folks in AMAZON-LAND must try this to believe it. Also works on brass. This tip alone, made this the best medical appointment ever.
customer_reviews.author: Quincy Girl

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Had some build-up on my exhaust tips that was bugging me because regular soap and water wasn't getting near removing it. So I looked for something specifically for cleaning metal and aluminium and came across this. Mothers is a good name in detailing so I bought it. My exhaust tips now look great, as does the rest of the chrome on my car. Only complaint I guess would be the consistency of the paste. It's kind of jelly like, and not as easy as it could be to use, hence the 4 stars rather than 5. But in terms of results, it works great.
customer_reviews.author: S. Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Mothers Polish, the fastest polishing agent I’ve ever used for a mirror like shine.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing. Polishes with little effort but can bring metal to a mirror like shine. Very messy and will turn black in seconds while rubbing. Black goo will get on everything so use gloves and an old shirt or you will ruin your clothes. Even though very messy, it comes off your hands fairly easily with soap and water. I’ve used many other polishes and most do a great job. This polish does a fabulous job. Surface needs to be very clean to start. After that, just rub it and keep it moist with paste. Doesn’t work as well after it starts drying up. Just buff off and reapply.
customer_reviews.author: JSan

customer_reviews.title: the best polish in my opinion
customer_reviews.text: i have always loved mothers polish for anything metal! i have used this to clean up copper back to almost mirror polish, but most recently purchased to remove an anodization from something i purchased. This worked great as you can see from the photos! just put some compound on a microfiber cloth and work it on. The polish itself is white, but after you begin to remove metals it gets darker and darker. once its dark wipe the polish off the product and begin to buff your item with a clean rag. you can get great results with this polish with only a little elbow grease!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sargent Dude

customer_reviews.title: Amazing polish at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: Love this product! I bought a $4000 glassblowing torch that had arrived scuffed & scratched. I was recommended this mothers mag metal polish & it did not disappoint! In a few minutes of rubbing I returned the stainless steel barrel of the glass torch to a mirror like shine! I even decided to use it on some brass glass tools & it cleaned them up like new also! It’s a large tub that should last me years if I use it on small to medium sized polishing projects. And for the price I will not hesitate to buy again when I do run out!
customer_reviews.author: ERIC DUYETTE

customer_reviews.title: Great for my stained glass projects
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my stained glass projects (after solder but before patina) and it works perfectly. Its SLIGHTLY abrasive, so I find it useful before patina (so that the solder is completely flux free and I think the patina sticks better if recently abraded) rather than after (as I'm afraid it will rub off the patina if I do it after). A little goes a long way so it's good value and it smells nice!
customer_reviews.author: ALLFLUKSD

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: I work with a lot of Vintage polished aluminum Engine cases and find that this polish often dies more hard than good. My standard process is multi-stage dry/wet sanding followed by buffing in stages. Once clean, I Xylene wipe then use Protect-a-clear. Its really labor intensive and I’ve tried to shortcut every step using Mothers. I find it takes me backward every time. It darkens the metal and is difficult to polish back out. Ive tried it on all sorts of aluminum and feel like the difference made is minimal. Mothers has a definite fanclub out there so I’m sure it helps a ton of people, just not me.
customer_reviews.author: Ryzeldorf

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Lacanche
customer_reviews.text: I bought this on recommendation from Art Culinaire after installing my beautiful Lacanche range with brass burner caps, knobs and handles. You see, my boyfriend thought it a good idea to melt butter in a spoon over my burner right after I had it installed and it tarnished my burner cap really bad...and I thought I would never get it out. Thanks to this paste, the tarnish came right out with a buffer and looks brand new again. I'm so happy it was recommended and I didn't have to replace my burner cap! It saved the day and saved me from being mad at him so, both are very good things :).
customer_reviews.author: Sunflower

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is remarkable.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is remarkable. I use it to polish and remove rust from antique swords. It works much more effectively than the other polishes i've tried before - namely Noxon and Mother's Chrome polish. In fact , it works almost too well - that is if you want to preserve some of the existing patina. You might want to use this stuff sparingly and cautiously. However, if you want to power through some tough black rust, this polish will do better than anything else i've come across.
customer_reviews.author: G. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Love this stuff
customer_reviews.text: I Polish my semi rims every year and this stuff works the best that I have found. I tried the new mothers bullet which is a lot more expensive and it didn't do as good of a job. I use a buffer and polishing wheel on a Dewalt drill. Takes time but works great.
customer_reviews.author: Drexel

customer_reviews.title: The Positive Reviews are Accurate
customer_reviews.text: I just used this to clean a piece of aluminum I had cut up with plasma cutter. There were scorchers and burns everywhere. That was no problem for this product. Once the polishing was complete the whole thing was shiny. In the directions it indicates no rubbing pressure is necessary. I found this to be true. The compound sort of reacts with the very top layer of the metal and turns black. It takes a little bit of time to figure out how to use a bit more of the compound to then remove the black residue and buff it to a final finish.
customer_reviews.author: Ellen

customer_reviews.title: multi use product
customer_reviews.text: this is great for aluminum diamond plate but use a regular terry cloth cotton rag no microfiber cloth and its great for polishing shower door frames the silver anodized and gold ones removes waterspots makes like new ohh yess and its very effective for removing oxidation on auto paint and scuff marks a restores the shine i know i was in auto body and paint repair for 40 plus years ....
customer_reviews.author: walter

customer_reviews.title: Great metal polish for many metal pieces
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this Mother's Mag & Aluminum polish on the chrome pieces of vintage sewing machines. A little product goes a long way & gives great result. I know this has traditionally been used for metal parts of automobiles, but it is good on many different metal parts. I am adding 2 photos showing a before and an after of a sewing machine case buckle. I had decided that a stronger sanding attachment would cause more damage to my vintage case. So only a buffing pad on a variable speed dremel, & a bit of Mother's Mag poilish gave me this result.
customer_reviews.author: Maria Marko

customer_reviews.title: You'd be amazed at what you can shine up with this stuff!!!!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff lasts forever and has a million uses around the house from cleaning up original steel rimmed tires to cleaning chrome parts pans. My son loves this stuff and swears by it. A little goes along way he says. So far he's used it on everything possible around the house that is metal. Be careful not to let it sit too long on anything metal he says and don't use anything scratchy with it or it will leave scratch marks on your metal object you want cleaned up. Try a small test area first he says.
customer_reviews.author: Linda P.

customer_reviews.title: Powerful polisher
customer_reviews.text: This is certainly effective stuff. I used it on aluminum and it put a better shine on it than anything else I've tried. It does take a bit of elbow grease, though. Be aware you should only use this if you want the result to be a shiny high polish. If you are trying to use it to clean aluminum with a more matte or brushed finish, it will not restore to the original finish, it will polish it to a high shine.
customer_reviews.author: Kronin323Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product for all metals.
customer_reviews.text: Mother's Polish is great for so many applications on the car, and especially in the home. In addition to using it on my wheels, lug nuts, etc, it is also terrific for aluminum shower enclosures in the bath, and for stainless in the kitchen. In addition to cleaning and polishing it leaves an invisible coating that helps to keep things clean and free of corrosion. I even use it on the outside of my Copper pots and pans. I also like the larger sizes available.
customer_reviews.author: Mark F. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Amazing results with Minimal Effort!
customer_reviews.text: This product is ridiculously easy to use--blot on, massage in, buff off, and even the most abused pieces are shining in minutes! I bought it to breathe new life into the nickel-plated parts of a vintage typewriter and was astonished at the minimal amount of elbow grease required to build up a dazzling shine. Will definitely be purchasing this again!
customer_reviews.author: CompteVonCount

customer_reviews.title: Just go ahead and buy it
customer_reviews.text: Inexpensive and reliable. My steps: 1. Spray wheel cleaner into surface and use a brush to remove dirt and dust. Then rinse with water 2. Use 0000 steel wool to scrub away any heavy contaminants (apply wheel cleaner or soap as needed), then rinse again. 3. Apply metal polish to surface with your hand and use a new 0000 steel wool to scrub the polish (doing this step without the steel wool will not give you the results you want) 4. Finally, use a clean microfiber towel to remove residue from polish
customer_reviews.author: JL

customer_reviews.title: Because I’m so Shiny!
customer_reviews.text: Really there is no shine like mother’s. I use this to polish sewing machine parts and I have a lot of machines. The depth of shine is really amazing. This is not for painted surfaces.....but, if you have a desire to make all purists mad and potentially ruin your paint and you really cannot get the dirt off with anything else .... use at your own risk. I do it, it can leave swirls, but you can use a good carbon wax after and you can have a better result than nothing.
customer_reviews.author: KnittedLauren

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff
customer_reviews.text: I have tried several products on my aluminum wheels so when I saw this posted on FB I immediately ordered Mothers Mag and Aluminum Polish. My 3 year old wheels were looking pretty bad with a lot of hard water spots. This stuff really works great. Done by hand it takes a fair amount of effort but the results are well worth it. Thanks for sharing!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Caution: May create and addiction to polishing stuff
customer_reviews.text: Is this magic? I think it's magic. Heaven help me, I'm now polishing everything in sight!!! I even used this on a rattle can spray paint job on a bicycle frame I did. That's right, I spray painted it and polished it with this aluminum polish. It did just enough smoothing to cut some of the orange peel, but wasn't abrasive and did nothing but make the paint look smoother and shinier. I do also use it on aluminum. I'm slowly polishing every bicycle part I have and the results are phenomenal. It gets results fast too!
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect polish at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Wow. This is the finest, low impact polish I've ever used. I've used this on a number of different things, but a good example is removing unnecessary logos from plastic products to improve the look. Scratching them off, using abrasives, or polishes that aren't this fine all damage the plastic very noticeably. This product removes things of that nature completely without any visual damage. I couldn't be happier, and this single tub will last me forever.
customer_reviews.author: J. Greeno

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these and one was shipped perfect but the other one was leaking because the lid was loose. Thankfully it was in its own packaging so the other items weren’t full of this but it was still a mess to clean up as I got it all over my hands and my shorts. I wish I could write a review on shipping and packaging but it doesn’t give me the option to do that. So I’m giving this three stars because of how it was packaged and shipped.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Quintero

customer_reviews.title: Takes elbow grease but did work for me.
customer_reviews.text: I had a serving dish that was given as a gift. I neglected to read the instructions and I put it in the dishwasher. It came out discolored. I went to the manufacturer's website to figure out how to fix my mistake and they recommended mother's polish. I decided to go with whatever they recommended. It DID work. It took a lot a lot of elbow grease and I actually am not completely satisfied, but it does work better than any product I tried before looking to see what the manufacturer recommended. I would recommend using old rags that you can throw away after use, I tried to wash the ones I used and was unsuccessful.
customer_reviews.author: Cannin314

customer_reviews.title: Best one I’ve used
customer_reviews.text: This stuff worked great for me. I know everyone has different expectations and different views on what’s shiny. These wheels are 10 years old and I used another brand polish 6 months ago. The before picture is from the other polish and the after picture is from today after using Mother’s. I did it the old fashioned way with a 5” circle polishing pad micro fiber towels to wipe clean. The heavy oxidation won’t come completely off but with a couple applications to several of the spots it’s 10x better. Hope this helps. I recommend this polish.
customer_reviews.author: Chris M.

customer_reviews.title: *BEWARE*. I think the jar blew up!  Half of it was everywhere!
customer_reviews.text: I’m sure this is a fine product, however, the packaging fell just a little short of expectations. In other words, when I opened the box it was all over the damn place including, but not limited to, my clothes and one dog. There were two other items in the box so I had to rinse those off before opening them! I’ll give it five stars because I know the product works well. But negative a thousand stars for having to clean up...like everything.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johns

customer_reviews.title: Makes a great stropping compound.
customer_reviews.text: I use this product on denim to strop a straight razor, and I find it to be very effective. Mother's on denim, then 0.25 micron on the flesh side of the leather, then plain grain side of the leather. Using this method, my razor gets sharp enough to push cut green Rizla papers the short way. If you know sharpness testing, you know that this is a reliable indicator of an edge that is extremely sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Hyman Ramirez

customer_reviews.title: Shower door looks like new!
customer_reviews.text: Our shower door is 10 years old, and had a film on it that made it look old. We tried everything to get it clean. This product did the job. The aluminum on the doors looks brand new. It was easy to use. Did not have to scrub hard at all. I had a buffer on my power drill, but we really didn't need it. It had a great shine with just the product.
customer_reviews.author: Donald K. Devinney

customer_reviews.title: It really works well. Polishes a hard to get rid of dullness from Stainless Steel.
customer_reviews.text: I saw a video on YouTube where someone used this product, to polish up a really dull finish on a stainless steel revolver. I have tried everything on my old Smith and Wesson, but couldn’t brighten up the finish, no matter what I did. I ordered this product, applied it with a minimum of effort...and it really did the trick! It brightened it up to almost a mirror like finish! The product does not have an odor, or unpleasantness to the touch. I own a lot of stainless steel kitchen apparel, and firearms, and I’m here to tell you that this is my new go-to product!
customer_reviews.author: B. Channell

customer_reviews.title: Works on chrome-painted plastics
customer_reviews.text: I used this to polish a chrome-painted plastic grill on the front of my car. This product worked very well. I was initially worried the product would be too harsh for use on faux chrome auto parts, but it seemed to be quite safe. I don't think it will compromise the underlying plastic at all. It seems to shine faux chrome just like it shines real metal. With a little light buffing, the product removed water spot stains and some discolorations. And I am impressed at how well this stuff seems to keep the grill looking good even after washing the car multiple times.
customer_reviews.author: cl

customer_reviews.title: This stuff is magic!
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is magic! Hand polished a set of clear/peeling VW wheels, got down to wet sanding and rubbing compound, but was disappointed with the finish. I was about to give up and spray paint them, but thought I’d give this a shot, and boy am I thankful! This stuff adds sheen like magic. I don’t know what voodoo this stuff uses, but it should keep using it!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Brian Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Mothers  Mag & Aluminum Polish
customer_reviews.text: For decades Mothers Polish, For me it's been # ONE..I Use it all time.....
customer_reviews.author: Alberto C.

customer_reviews.title: HEADLIGHTS !
customer_reviews.text: I was looking through cleaners and noticed a review from - KEONI - about headlight so I could not wait to get it to try it on my yellow headlights and if they are plastic it just melts off with no sanding or scrubbing ( TAKE THAT LIKE NEW ) - my truck has glass headlights and it does take some scrubbing on them but still works great - Thank You ! - KEONI
customer_reviews.author: Aries1

customer_reviews.title: This polish is awesome. It isn't exactly clear on here
customer_reviews.text: This polish is awesome. It isn't exactly clear on here, but it can be used on stainless steel. I recently bought a car with a stainless exhaust that the polished tips were solid black from never being cleaned. With a lot of time and elbow grease, this polish brought them back to life.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: NOT safe for all metals..........
customer_reviews.text: First line on back of package lets you know it's not made for chrome. I have chrome pipes. Waste.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best polish out there
customer_reviews.text: This is the "gold standard" for polish. I get great results and and a beautiful shine. At work my wife noticed a professional polishing silver with tis product - same thing ... a beautiful shine. It's easy to use and a lot less harmful chemicals. This is the best polish out there.
customer_reviews.author: Solohvs

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I bought it for
customer_reviews.text: I know it’s not for headlights.. but.. I saw YouTube videos on this and restoring headlights. I was not looking to make them sparkle like new, just wanted something to clean them up.I did buy a sealant that provides uv protection that I applied after. I was going to buff it with a drill attachment but just my luck I couldn’t find the battery to the drill.. so I did this by hand and I must say the results are amazing and far exceeded my expectations. The headlight still has some hazy spots but I’m sure if I would’ve put more effort I would’ve got better results. The headlights are also clearer looking in person.
customer_reviews.author: SimplyBlessed

customer_reviews.title: Brand New
customer_reviews.text: I cannot state enough about how wonderfully this polish works! I have some '96 GMC 5 star rims that haven't been polished since '95, and the rims look brand new. I was able to break out a drill with a polishing tip, and this stuff is magic. You'll have results just like me if you get this polish . . . and do like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Scotta Blanchat

customer_reviews.title: Saved my Kitchenaid attachments!
customer_reviews.text: I foolishly put my Kitchenaid accessories in the dishwasher thinking it would be fine, but I was wrong. They came out dull, dark, and even worse - what I assume is the oxidation layer would come off onto your hands, towels, etc.. I was resigned to possibility that these were ruined and I was going to throw them away, but then I came across this polish. After reading some of the reviews, I figured it wouldn't hurt especially since this was much cheaper than buying all new attachments. Well, I am very glad I bought this! It took some elbow grease, but my attachments look almost good as new. I highly recommend this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: boomer sooner

customer_reviews.title: Product is good but I'd probably not buy online again
customer_reviews.text: First time it came in the box and was opened paste everywhere. Replacement was also opened but less messy. Ended up just taking 2nd one as it was. Shipping this is a challenge from here. They need to keep the lid on tight and keep it from opening somehow. The product itself is a decent polish used for solar cells
customer_reviews.author: John Kemp

customer_reviews.title: Works like magic
customer_reviews.text: This product works but too much elbow grease is required. But it depends on the degree of tarnish and rust on the metal you need to polish. I used it on my metal address numbers and old wall lantern. Didnt turn out perfect but definitely a lot better than prior to using this cream. Im happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: lianzon

customer_reviews.title: Best polish u could get but with the right cloth.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent stuff, would give it 5 stars since it recommend using regular cloth but in my experience microfiber had best result when apply, with lots elbow-grease of course.
customer_reviews.author: MARCUS WU

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I decided to polish my G3 barrel to a chrome finish and use this Mag polish to finish it off. I purchased a cheap dreamer tool with an almost 200 pc kit of attachments and used it to apply the polish with a polishing disc and it works great! Highly recommend and will be soon using it on my chrome exhaust tips.
customer_reviews.author: BLynch

customer_reviews.title: Flitz Works Better
customer_reviews.text: I purchased Mothers 05101 Mag & Aluminum Polish to polish various aluminum items including our Kirby Vacuum Cleaners. The container I received was cracked and maybe the Mother's had dried out, but using the polish I wasn't impressed as Flitz Polish does a much better job. I probably should have returned the product but at the time that would have been way down on my list.
customer_reviews.author: Dragonheart

customer_reviews.title: Very impressive product
customer_reviews.text: I had a small project, it was to restore the radio flyers tricycle of my little one. The handlebar was cover by rust over the year. With some elbow grease and patience the results was over my expectations. The handlebar it's shiny now not like new but my little on can enjoy his tricycle without having his hands cover by the rust.
customer_reviews.author: Prass

customer_reviews.title: NOT for Chrome
customer_reviews.text: Searched chrome polish on Amazon for my Moto Guzzi (chrome gas tank) and this was one of the many recommended items. Saw other chrome-like items on the photos and purchased. Well, the first sentence on the back of the actual product (but nowhere on this page) says “not recommended for chrome or gold plating”
customer_reviews.author: Ryne

customer_reviews.title: Simply works!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product. I had surface scratches and general discoloration in some stainless steel. I tried a number of other polishers, Brasso, etc., none worked. This stuff worked like a charm. All scratches gone in seconds. Used a microfiber cloth and a small dab of this and it worked like magic.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Evans

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: Prepare to roam your house for all things metal to bring to bright polish! It's messy, but wear rubber gloves to make easy clean up. This product really works on pewter and aluminum items. I used it on my Nambe pieces and they have been brought back to life!
customer_reviews.author: PairadachsMom

customer_reviews.title: From an artist: polished aluminum can!
customer_reviews.text: I am PUMPED to be writing this review! I'm an artist. I needed to polish a soda can to a near mirror finish. This polish was effective and incredibly easy to use. You can see here the difference in the can between the hazy portion polished with 3,000 grit sandpaper, and the portion polished with the Mother's Mag, after just one pass. I wouldn't be able to do makeup in it, but you can see that I'm wearing a pink shirt and leaned against brick. With more passes, I'm SURE I could get it even clearer.
customer_reviews.author: Linnea Milk

customer_reviews.title: Still the best!
customer_reviews.text: Mother's has made this metal polish for ages. I bought this to polish the grilles on a 1966 Ford F250 crew cab, 1969 Ford F250 crew cab and a 1952 Chevy pickup. It just does wonders on chrome bumpers, shiny tin and other metal parts meant to shine including old metal hub caps. I just love this stuff!
customer_reviews.author: RMVA

customer_reviews.title: Shockingly good
customer_reviews.text: My husband spend several hours cleaning the cymbals on his drum set and only saw a slight improvement so we ordered this. We couldn't believe how well it worked in a fraction of the time. I actually didn't know cymbals could be this beautiful. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Florida Girl

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing. My Katanas have never looked better.
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of cutting with katanas (Tamashigiri) thus the metal eventually stains and can corrode. This polish worked wonders. I was able to get the stains off in minutes with only light scrubbing. Mind you these are stains that I was unable to remove with 3 in one oil which is what I usually use to clean the swords. Also works well on my daily knives. For the price, I simply cannot be happy enough with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ada Wong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product 10 stars. Its a must buy.
customer_reviews.text: It work to clean my whole car body. Its white but over the years it looks cream. After using it on the whole body its pure white again. If i could i would give it 10 stars. This product is amazing. Just use a washcloth and apply after washing and drying then wash again and bam a miracle.
customer_reviews.author: Sheena

customer_reviews.title: My results weren't as good as those on youtube and my husband and son ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I watched people cleaning their headlights on youtube using this stuff, it does work, but you do have to use quite a bit of elbow grease. My results weren't as good as those on youtube and my husband and son used this stuff on 4 different vehicles.
customer_reviews.author: 40+Budget Mom of 3

customer_reviews.title: Makes old chrome look new again.
customer_reviews.text: This product reminds me of Pig Snot metal polish. It works great on most metal/chrome finishes. I use old socks or tee shirts or apply the product and before it completely dries I use a Microfiber cloth to wipe off. On tough jobs a second coat could be necessary. This product will make aluminum look like chrome.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Fred

customer_reviews.title: Great product for metal
customer_reviews.text: I have used Mothers Polish for years on my rims and other metal items. It works great. You definitely have to use elbow grease, but the spots come away leaving a great finish, which I follow with Maguiars polish. The price through Amazon was very good.
customer_reviews.author: Lle

customer_reviews.title: Picks up where it's competitors can't
customer_reviews.text: We bought 4 polishing products to try out on a set of chrome rims. Got wenol, griots chrome polish, mothers chrome polish, and blue magic. Wenol just didn't cut it like it said it would. Had to use the Mother's over top of it to make it look better.
customer_reviews.author: moonfox

customer_reviews.title: Always great polish...
customer_reviews.text: Mothers has always been he best - great for wheels yes, but also for most anything you want to polish - headlights - works great for gun parts - feed ramps etc... Also nice size for the money compared to Flitz or what ever that comes in small tubes... When things turn black you know its working! rub black away and polish with clean cloth and see the shine...
customer_reviews.author: Larry D.

customer_reviews.title: Mother's Mag & Alum Polish is the BOMB!
customer_reviews.text: Check out my 2006 Aluminum Boat Cleat (Never polished and pretty weathered by Salt Water and the elements). Check out AFTER photos, they LOOK BRAND NEW. Couldn't be more pleased. It was NOT WITHOUT ELBOW GREASE, but WORTH the EFFORT! THANKS MOTHER'S!
customer_reviews.author: CA Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Worked great on my aluminum rims
customer_reviews.text: I applied the compound using my cordless drill and cloth polishing wheels. I think using a hand cloth and "elbow grease" would have worked just as good. PLUS: this worked great on cleaning my truck headlight lens. Headlights are a light brighter now.
customer_reviews.author: Flyin' Hawaiian

customer_reviews.title: Works great on fogged headlight
customer_reviews.text: Works great on fogged headlight, you don't have to push hard and it really clears the headlight fog area but after a couple months the fog comes back. I have not tried the clear spray paint with UV blockers on the headlights after a good scrubbing but I will
customer_reviews.author: Joe Mama

customer_reviews.title: Big brakes sidekick
customer_reviews.text: Recent fot new big brake rotors and pads on my ride in which in breakin will cause some heavy dust. Especially with slotted rotors and street/track pads. This stuff will eat this and keep going to a high polish. Amazing and my go to. A definte must for wheel polish and clean. Whatever your wheel needs this gots you.
customer_reviews.author: Sinner

customer_reviews.title: Polish
customer_reviews.text: Product did an alright job polishing, I got close to similar results using spray on type products where you don’t need as much as elbow grease to get a decent shine. This might work better with a drill and you need to spend some time to get favorable results.
customer_reviews.author: Sunil

customer_reviews.title: Nice product
customer_reviews.text: It’s a nice product but bought it to stop the gun from having an issue with the bullet loading into the chamber. I was told to polish over and over for a smoother load. Unfortunately it didn’t fix my problem but it didn’t state that it would.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: The best I've used
customer_reviews.text: This is the first aluminum polish that I really can say it is much better than any I have tried before. I found that the best results came when you did small areas and wiped off the polishing compound regularly. It produced a very clear bright shine.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: This Mothers works fantastic for cleaning brass .....
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for 20 + years, but never to polish Mag wheels! I have been using it to clean and polish all types of metal, mainly Aluminum and Brass. Works good on plastic, such as clear lens using a microfiber cloth. If it dries out, just add a little water and stir well, and it comes back to life!
customer_reviews.author: Ray West

customer_reviews.title: Best metal polish around
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic. As long as you make sure to prep the metal surface before hand, you can turn any metal surface into a mirror. Just be sure to sand or file any pits before, otherwise it'll remain pocket marked after polishing. But it works well, easy to use, and it's such a large can that I don't think I'll ever need to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Mason

customer_reviews.title: It's like magic
customer_reviews.text: This product is like magic! Rub a little on, wipe it off and be amazed! I used this on my bicycle that has been stripped down to it's raw aluminum frame. Polished it with this stuff and it looks incredible, like shiny chrome! Buy it!
customer_reviews.author: Maestro

customer_reviews.title: Used it to polish my headlights
customer_reviews.text: This product works on my truck's headlights. If you have a polisher it would be easier and faster. Before using it the plastic has a milky color but now the lights can pass through the plastic with brightness. There are nice videos on YouTube on how to do it and if it works for me it might works for you to.
customer_reviews.author: Boeing

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I saw a few videos about headlights restoration using this product and I wanted to try it as well. I was able to notice the difference after the first application and was able to restore them almost completely. I used a 4000 RPM polisher, perhaps there would be better results with a higher RPM polisher.
customer_reviews.author: Jairo Rosario

customer_reviews.title: Worked unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: I have used many different types of metal cleaners, and basically did a comparison to some, and I have to say the Mothers Polish, the cloth had more black residue on it which meant it did a better clean. I use this to clean up Antique Slot Machines And it worked "reel" nice
customer_reviews.author: Paul B

customer_reviews.title: Superior
customer_reviews.text: Just amazing on steel, gold, brass, WHATEVER! I prep surfaces with ascending grit up to around 10000 first. Mirror like.
customer_reviews.author: SuperTechX

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic to get a mirror polish on your gun.
customer_reviews.text: Polished my S&W 629 44 cal to a mirror finish by hand, so not messing up the edges and contouring of the gun. Watch som Youtube videos on how to use Mothers to polish your gun. You won’t be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: alltrippy

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Used on motorhome wheels that were pretty dull, we didn't think they would ever shine again. It took time but using the Mothers cone in a drill, the wheels look brand new. The wheels clean easily and maintain the shine.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis46

customer_reviews.title: Best silver and brass polish I've found!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on the brass railings in my church, which are over 120 years old. They hold the shine, resist smudges of hand on the rail. Today, I polished the silver communion flagon, chalice, and other items - all antique, and they were blinging! Excellent outcome all around. Great product, and I'm very happy with results.
customer_reviews.author: Gtokaren

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Used to polish the aluminum engine case of a motorcycle that sat outside for 26 years. I used foam pads that attach to the end of a drill. If doing it again would use a cloth pad. This product hands down works.
customer_reviews.author: wwahbe

customer_reviews.title: Has a great use.
customer_reviews.text: For those that don't know it, this product has a great use. It cleans headlights. The headlight covers are plastic and get yellow and faded. Rub some of this on and wipe it off, wallah, clean see though covers.
customer_reviews.author: ronald goodin

customer_reviews.title: really clean parts prior to using polish , you get what you put into your project
customer_reviews.text: This product was recommended by my neighbor who works on show cars . My project was to protect chrome guide rails on panel saw exposed to weather . They look fantastic ,items started out as solid rusted metal , last phase was to apply many coats to make them gleam chrome again . ( they passed my neighbors inspection )
customer_reviews.author: Rich T.

customer_reviews.title: Gets the ugly stuff out the metals
customer_reviews.text: The product acomplish the end results i was expecting, as soon i got it i tried in different metals i could find in my house. Some got fully cleaned in the first or second application, the worst case (the coin) took +5 aplication and buff clean. 4 stars (+works as advertised,+it have the basic instructions and warnings,- the soft smell it have and leave in the metal made me a little bit dizzy after spending more than an hour using it. But it goes off with time.) I love the product and I am planning to use it to clean the exhaust pipe of my car. wear gloves!
customer_reviews.author: Luis Alejandro

customer_reviews.title: It's OK
customer_reviews.text: Nothing special. Does what it's supposed to do...polishes metal. Make sure the metal is fairly clean before applying...it's a polish not a cleaner. Also, the drying time is longer than any other metal polished I've used, so give it enough time to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Love this product
customer_reviews.text: I've been a vintage car owner for the past 35 years and have used a lot of different metal polishing products. I bought this for the first time on Amazon and I love it. Easy to use and does a fantastic job on my raw aluminum rims and trim. I use it on my boat too.
customer_reviews.author: buyamerican

customer_reviews.title: Works great on  headlights
customer_reviews.text: I used this to clean my headlights that were yellow . They totally look new . Easy to apply and buff out with a electric compound pad . Just make sure you keep the pad moving so you don’t burn a spot on your light.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Kelly

customer_reviews.title: EXCELLENT PRODUCT, EXCELLENT CHOICE!
customer_reviews.text: Awe-some! Works great, and the best part is, it's water soluble for easy clean-up. I just wish it was a tiny bit thicker, because it readily flies off of the polishing wheel at moderate to high speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Wingnut

customer_reviews.title: Be careful which wheel cleaner you use prior!
customer_reviews.text: tried this on my aluminum rims. Worked pretty well. Cleaned wheels with a wheel cleaner and product won't buff out of rims now. Does not buff out corrosion from dog piss and wheel cleaner from Magu*^#s.
customer_reviews.author: Diana R

customer_reviews.title: This fixes more than rims
customer_reviews.text: I use this to polish faded headlights and it works perfect for buffing out scratches in your paint. Use this with a DA on your entire car and you will remove all swirls and your car will look perfect!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product
customer_reviews.text: It shines all the metals. I brought this for my harley but ended up using inside the house as well. It makes things look new.
customer_reviews.author: Sudha

customer_reviews.title: Always a necessity!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Mothers has a million uses from automotive to polishing triggers. This is always on my workbench! Thanks, Mothers!! Same price as Walmart without waiting in line! 5 Star
customer_reviews.author: Randall BryanTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: My go-to polish
customer_reviews.text: This polish will clean more than mags and aluminum I use it for a variety of household items. It is good for silver, silver-plate, copper, brass etc. I am still searching for other uses. Who knows?
customer_reviews.author: elle

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Headlight Restorer!!
customer_reviews.text: Can’t believe how well this worked on our headlights. Took all of 15 minutes to make them look like new. We have tried a few other products and nothing else has worked. Price was excellent!
customer_reviews.author: Elle

product_meta.title: Mothers 05101 Mag & Aluminum Polish - 10 oz
product_meta.description: Size:Mag & Aluminum Polish, 10 oz.Mothers Mag and Aluminum Polish - 10 ounce features the legendary metal polish. Mothers secret formula balances a brilliant shine with ease-of-use for aluminum wheels and parts, brass, alloys and accessories. The application is just a matter of a clean cloth and a little elbow grease. The mag and aluminum polish is strong enough to put a shine to the most neglected metals and gentle enough to use on a regular basis.
feature_bullets: Apply with a clean cloth and a little elbow grease for a shine
Gentle enough to use on a regular basis
Regular use provides a long lasting benefit to your vehicle

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars4,982 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
